quiz.question: Which leader founded the All India Muslim League in 1906?
Which 1935 act provided provincial autonomy and proposed an all-India federation subject to princely states?
Which Mughal noble led the revolt in Awadh and became a central figure in 1857 under Nana Sahib?
Which treaty in 1809 gave the British control over foreign affairs of the Nizam of Hyderabad?
Which leader is known for the campaign against untouchability and led movements for Dalit rights?
Who was the first Indian to preside over the Indian National Congress session in 1888?
Who wrote the nationalist newspaper Kesari and was a prominent leader of the Extremist movement?
Which 1877 proclamation by Queen Victoria promised to respect Indian rights after the 1857 rebellion?
Which 18th century treaty allowed British residency at Peshawar influencing Afghan politics later?
Which leader popularized the slogan 'Swaraj is my birthright' in the early 20th century?
Which city hosted the Cripps Mission negotiations in 1942 seeking Indian support during World War II?
Which province's peasant uprising in 1937 was led by the Tebhaga movement demanding two-thirds share for tenants?
Which 1915 return of an expatriate leader revitalized Indian nationalism?
Which leader started the Home Rule League in 1916 to demand self-government within the British Empire?
options: Both Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak
quiz.answer: Both Annie Besant and Bal Gangadhar Tilak

quiz.question: Which act of 1833 abolished the East India Company's commercial activities, making it solely an administrative body?
